cards.title: Packaging Policy Review
cards.prompt: Your packaging generates significant waste. What's your approach?

options.label: Switch to 100% compostable packaging
options.description: Higher upfront cost but eliminates plastic waste
options.explanation: Compostable packaging reduces landfill waste significantly but requires supplier changes and cost increases.

options.label: Implement reusable container program
options.explanation: Reusable containers eliminate single-use waste but require logistics setup and customer buy-in.

options.label: Minimal packaging redesign
options.description: Reduce packaging by 30%, keep existing materials
options.explanation: Reducing packaging is cost-effective but provides moderate environmental impact.

cards.title: Portion Size Adjustment
cards.prompt: Food waste from oversized portions is increasing. How do you respond?

options.label: Reduce all portions by 20%
options.explanation: Smaller portions reduce waste and costs but may disappoint customers initially.

options.label: Offer multiple portion sizes
options.explanation: Choice empowers customers but adds operational complexity.

cards.title: Supplier Evaluation: Local vs Bulk
cards.prompt: Your current bulk supplier offers lower prices but higher emissions. A local farm co-op is available.

options.label: Switch to local farm co-op
options.explanation: Local sourcing dramatically cuts transport emissions and builds community ties but increases costs.

options.label: Hybrid approach: 50% local, 50% bulk
options.explanation: Splitting suppliers moderates both cost impact and emission reductions.

options.label: Negotiate greener shipping with bulk supplier
options.explanation: Incremental improvements without major changes to supply chain.

cards.title: Comprehensive Food Waste Audit
cards.prompt: You need data to understand waste patterns. How deep should the audit go?

options.label: Full 30-day audit with third-party consultant
options.description: Detailed tracking of all waste streams
options.explanation: Professional audit provides actionable insights but requires investment.

options.label: Internal staff tracking for 2 weeks
options.description: Train existing staff to log waste
options.explanation: Lower-cost approach with moderate data quality.

cards.title: Composting Program Launch
cards.prompt: Organic waste represents 40% of your total waste. Consider composting infrastructure.

options.label: Install on-site composting system
options.explanation: On-site composting eliminates organic waste transport and creates usable compost.

options.label: Partner with commercial composting service
options.explanation: Commercial service handles logistics but adds recurring fees.

options.label: Small pilot with select waste streams
options.description: Test composting with coffee grounds only
options.explanation: Low-risk pilot builds knowledge before full commitment.

cards.title: Community Sustainability Outreach
cards.prompt: Trust is declining. How do you communicate your sustainability efforts?

options.label: Launch public sustainability dashboard
options.explanation: Transparency builds trust by making impact measurable and visible.

options.label: Publish quarterly sustainability reports
options.explanation: Regular reporting shows commitment without real-time overhead.

options.label: Social media campaign highlighting wins
options.explanation: Low-cost awareness building but may appear performative.

cards.title: Energy-Efficient Equipment Investment
cards.prompt: Your kitchen equipment is outdated and inefficient. Consider upgrades.

options.label: Replace all major equipment with Energy Star models
options.explanation: New equipment dramatically reduces energy use but requires significant capital.

options.label: Phase replacement over 18 months
options.explanation: Gradual approach spreads costs while delivering improvements.

options.label: Optimize existing equipment with better maintenance
options.explanation: Low-cost efficiency gains without capital expenditure.

cards.title: Menu Redesign for Lower Footprint
cards.prompt: Your menu features many high-emission items. Consider a sustainability-focused redesign.

options.label: Shift to 70% plant-based menu
options.explanation: Plant-based meals dramatically reduce emissions and often cost less.

options.label: Keep menu, source sustainably-raised meat/dairy
options.description: Higher quality, higher cost animal products
options.explanation: Ethical sourcing improves footprint without changing offerings.

options.label: Seasonal menu rotation with local ingredients
options.explanation: Seasonal approach optimizes for what's available locally.

cards.title: Community Backlash on Price Increases
cards.prompt: Customers are complaining about higher prices from sustainability initiatives. How do you respond?

options.label: Publish detailed cost breakdown showing why prices increased
options.description: Educate on true cost of sustainability
options.explanation: Transparency helps customers understand value of changes.

options.label: Launch sliding-scale discount for low-income customers
options.description: Absorb cost for those who need it
options.explanation: Equity-focused approach maintains access despite price increases.

options.label: Temporarily roll back least popular changes
options.explanation: Pragmatic retreat to rebuild support before expanding again.

cards.title: Unexpected Budget Constraints
cards.prompt: Funding has been cut by 15%. What sustainability initiatives are protected?

options.label: Maintain waste reduction programs, cut emissions initiatives
options.explanation: Focus on tangible waste outcomes customers can see.

options.label: Maintain emissions programs, reduce waste spending
options.explanation: Climate-first approach even if less visible to customers.

options.label: Cut everything except efficiency improvements
options.description: Efficiency pays for itself over time
options.explanation: Invest only in changes that reduce ongoing costs.

cards.title: Water Conservation Initiative
cards.prompt: Water usage is higher than industry benchmarks. What's your strategy?

options.label: Install low-flow fixtures and sensors
options.explanation: Infrastructure upgrade reduces water and energy for heating.

options.label: Implement water-saving operational procedures
options.explanation: Behavioral changes with minimal cost but requiring ongoing enforcement.

cards.title: Renewable Energy Transition
cards.prompt: Your energy is 100% grid-sourced fossil fuels. Consider renewable options.

options.label: Install rooftop solar panels
options.explanation: Solar dramatically cuts emissions but requires major capital investment.

options.label: Switch to utility renewable energy plan
options.explanation: Immediate emission reduction with ongoing cost increase.

options.label: Join community solar cooperative
options.description: Share in local solar farm output
options.explanation: Collective approach reduces individual cost burden.

cards.title: Sustainability Training Program
cards.prompt: Staff lack knowledge to support sustainability goals. How comprehensive should training be?

options.label: Full-day workshop for all staff quarterly
options.explanation: Deep training builds culture but requires time and money.

options.label: Add sustainability module to onboarding
options.explanation: Baseline knowledge for all staff with minimal disruption.

cards.title: Delivery & Takeout Sustainability
cards.prompt: Delivery orders are growing. Single-use containers are a major waste source.

options.label: Implement reusable container delivery service
options.description: Customers return containers on next order
options.explanation: Eliminates single-use waste but adds logistics complexity.

options.label: Switch to certified compostable takeout containers
options.explanation: Reduces landfill impact if customers have composting access.

options.label: Discount for customers who bring their own containers
options.explanation: Customer-driven solution with minimal operational change.

cards.title: Surplus Food Donation Program
cards.prompt: You have consistent surplus food at end of day. What's your approach?

options.label: Daily donation partnership with local shelter
options.explanation: Redirects food from waste while serving community need.

options.label: List surplus on food rescue app
options.explanation: Flexible approach but less reliable than partnership.

cards.title: Carbon Offset Program Evaluation
cards.prompt: You can't eliminate all emissions. Consider purchasing carbon offsets.

options.label: Purchase verified carbon offsets for all operations
options.explanation: Offsets compensate for unavoidable emissions but add costs.

options.label: Fund local reforestation project directly
options.explanation: Visible local impact builds community connection.

options.label: Skip offsets, invest in direct emission reductions
options.explanation: Prioritize eliminating emissions over compensating for them.

cards.title: Sustainability Certification Program
cards.prompt: Third-party certifications can validate your efforts. Which do you pursue?

options.label: Pursue B Corporation certification
options.explanation: Rigorous certification signals serious commitment.

options.label: Green Restaurant Association certification
options.explanation: Targeted certification for food service operations.

options.label: Create own sustainability badge and criteria
options.explanation: Lower cost but less credibility without third-party validation.

cards.title: Supply Chain Sustainability Audit
cards.prompt: Your suppliers' practices affect your overall footprint. How deep do you audit?

options.label: Full lifecycle assessment of top 20 suppliers
options.explanation: Comprehensive data enables targeted supplier changes.

options.label: Send sustainability questionnaire to all suppliers
options.explanation: Lightweight approach gathers baseline information.

options.label: Audit only Tier 1 suppliers (direct relationships)
options.explanation: Manageable scope while addressing major impact sources.

cards.title: Sustainability Innovation Fund
cards.prompt: Set aside budget for experimental sustainability projects. How much?

options.label: Allocate 5% of revenue to innovation fund
options.explanation: Large fund enables ambitious experimental projects.

options.label: Allocate 2% of revenue to innovation fund
options.explanation: Modest investment allows controlled experimentation.

cards.title: Stakeholder Engagement Strategy
cards.prompt: Multiple groups want input on sustainability direction. How do you engage?

options.label: Form sustainability advisory council
options.explanation: Formal structure gives stakeholders voice in decisions.

options.label: Bi-annual town hall meetings
options.explanation: Public forums build transparency without ongoing commitment.

options.label: Online surveys and suggestion box
options.explanation: Low-touch engagement gathers input without meetings.

cards.title: Staff Performance Incentives
cards.prompt: Tie staff bonuses to sustainability metrics to drive accountability?

options.label: Team bonuses based on monthly waste reduction
options.explanation: Team incentives foster collaboration around shared goals.

options.label: Individual bonuses for sustainability suggestions implemented
options.explanation: Individual rewards encourage creative problem-solving.

options.label: Keep sustainability part of job expectations, no bonuses
options.explanation: Avoids financializing sustainability but may reduce urgency.

cards.title: Expansion vs Consolidation
cards.prompt: You have an opportunity to expand operations. How does this affect sustainability?

options.label: Expand with sustainability-first facility design
options.description: New location built to green standards
options.explanation: Growth opportunity to implement best practices from start.

options.label: Consolidate to single efficient location
options.explanation: Smaller footprint with economies of scale.

options.label: Defer expansion, optimize current operations first
options.explanation: Prove sustainability at current scale before growing.
